page.title: 09RACKLEY
page.content: ON THE VALLEY ROAD,ALONG THE SOUTHERN FOOTHILLS OF THE MENDIPS,THE VISITOR THROUGH RACKLEY BEFORE REALISING THAT HE HAS PASSED THROUGH A SETTLEMENT. TODAY THERE IS A ROW OF FOUR COTTAGES WITH A FEW ISOLATED HOUSES. THESE MAKE UP TODAYS RACKLEY. VERY DIFFERENT FROM THE DAYS WHEN NAVIGATION ON THE RIVER AXE WAS A REGULAR OCCURANCE,WHEN RACKLEY HAD ITS OWN LANDING STAGE AND WHEN GOODS WERE REGUALARLY BROUGHT IN AND TAKEN OUT. THE HAMLET NOW HAS NO AMENITIES AND THE LIVES OF THE PEOPLE ARE LINKED CLOSELY WITH AGRICULTURE. TO SUPPLEMENT THEIR INCOME, STRAWBERRIES ARE GROWN ON THE SOUTH FACING MENDIP SLOPES ADJACENT TO THEIR HOMES.
